0.title: Elon Musk to join Twitter's board of directors
0.article_body: Twitter is appointing the world's richest person Elon Musk to its board of directors after he disclosed a passive stake of 9.2% in the company. "He's both a passionate believer and intense critic of the service which is exactly what we need on Twitter, and in the boardroom," Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal tweeted. Musk is now Twitter's largest shareholder.

1.title: EVs in Delhi can be charged for free in the noon at 35 spots from June 1
1.article_body: EV owners in Delhi will be able to charge their vehicles for free between 12:00 pm and 3:00 pm from June 1 onwards, ElectriVa Founder Sumit Dhanuka said. The facility will be provided to commercial and non-commercial EVs at around 35 charging stations operational along the Ring Road. "We want to bolster Delhi's EV ecosystem," Dhanuka added.

2.title: Model from Brazil faces divorce from 1 of his 9 wives, says 'I wish to have 10 wives'
2.article_body: Arthur O Urso, a male model from Brazil who went viral after his marriage to nine different women is now facing divorce from one of his wives. He said she wants a divorce because she was "missing a monogamous relationship". However, he added that he plans to marry more women as "his wish has always been to have 10 wives".

3.title: Says a lot about toxic masculinity: Schumer on Will slapping Chris
3.article_body: Comedian Amy Schumer said actor Will Smith slapping presenter Chris Rock at the Oscars 2022 was "really upsetting". "It was just a f***ing bummer...I think it says so much about toxic masculinity," Schumer stated. Schumer, along with Regina Hall and Wanda Sykes, hosted the 94th Academy Awards. It was for the first time that three women hosted the Oscars.

4.title: Russian forces regrouping & preparing offensive in southeast: Ukraine
4.article_body: Russian forces are regrouping and preparing for an offensive in Ukraine's southeast, the Ukrainian military said. The military also said Russian forces aim "to establish full control over" two breakaway regions of Ukraine, which Russia has recognised as independent republics. Russian forces have retreated from northern Ukraine after Russia announced it would shift its focus from Kyiv.

5.title: US crypto billionaire-led FTX may invest in India's MPL: Report
5.article_body: US crypto billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried-led exchange FTX is in talks to invest in Bengaluru-based esports and mobile gaming platform Mobile Premier League (MPL), TechCrunch reported. MPL is looking to get the investment as an extension to its Series E funding at a valuation of $2.5 billion. Last year, MPL turned a unicorn with a $2.3 billion valuation.

6.title: 51% of women in Hyderabad are either overweight or obese: Report
6.article_body: As many as 51% of women in Hyderabad are either overweight or obese, as per a compendium by the Council for Social Development for 2019-20. Kumuram Bheem Asifabad district had the lowest percentage of women who were overweight or obese in the state in 2019-2020. The compendium has a comprehensive statistical picture of health and demographic status in Telangana.

7.title: Was easier to act with father than to have him as director: Shahid
7.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about working with father Pankaj Kapur in the film 'Jersey', said, "It was easier to act with him than to have him as a director." "It was much more relaxed. We used to get time to chill...have a cup of coffee together in between shots," Shahid added. Pankaj had directed Shahid in the 2011 film 'Mausam'.

8.title: Don't spit, disturb others: Pune Metro in etiquette manual for passengers
8.article_body: The Pune Metro has released a pamphlet named 'Metro Etiquettes' which has various directions for the passengers. "Spitting is a crime! It not only makes the place dirty but also can spread contagious diseases," the metro says in the pamphlet. It also asks passengers to keep the metro clean and not disturb other commuters with phone calls and music players.

9.title: Pune law student seeking education loan online cheated of ₹90,000
9.article_body: A 20-year-old Pune law student, seeking an education loan online, was cheated of ₹90,000, police said. The complainant came in contact with the fraudsters after calling on a number posted on a website. She was then asked to make multiple transfers in order to obtain a ₹5 lakh loan. A case has been registered under the IT Act, police added.

10.title: Ex-TCS staff turns part-time Zomato delivery agent, shares post on his challenges
10.article_body: A former TCS employee, Srinivasan Jayaraman's post on challenges he faced as a part-time Zomato delivery agent is being widely circulated. Jayaraman wrote about the inaccuracy of delivery locations of customers and restaurants. He said often phone numbers aren't properly updated and there were cases of long-distance delivery locations. "I salute those who choose this as a career," he said.

11.title: MP police team takes dip in Ganga with handcuffed man, served show-cause notice
11.article_body: A police team from Madhya Pradesh's Burhanpur that had travelled to Uttar Pradesh to arrest a man allegedly took a holy dip in the river Ganga with the handcuffed accused. The officers were served a show-cause notice for dereliction of duty, an officer said. The team should have returned directly to the police station after arresting the accused, he added.

12.title: Govt employees asked to use bicycles for office on Wednesdays in Lakshadweep
12.article_body: The Lakshadweep administration has announced that it'll observe 'Cycle Day' every Wednesday from April 6 and all government employees will have to come to the office on bicycles to beat pollution. Employees with disability or any medical condition will be exempted from this rule, an official order said. Government officials have been asked to not use motor vehicles on Wednesdays.

13.title: Gurugram's max temp to touch 45°C by Sat; IMD issues heatwave alert
13.article_body: IMD has issued a yellow heatwave alert for south Haryana districts, including Gurugram and Faridabad, till April 7. Further, in its weekly forecast, IMD has predicted the maximum temperature in Gurugram is likely to touch 45°C by April 9. Gurugram on Sunday recorded a maximum temperature of 42.3°C, the highest maximum temperature recorded in the city so far this year.

14.title: Ignore, he needs to run his house too: Anupam on Ashish's 'Shark Tank' spoof
14.article_body: Shaadi.com's Founder and Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal responded to a fan who said they felt "very bad" about the way Mittal was portrayed in popular YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani's spoof of the show, titled 'Sasta Shaark Tank'. In an Instagram comment, Mittal wrote, "Ignore, use bhi apna ghar chalana hai (Ashish has to run his house too)."

15.title: Over 25,000 foreigners overstayed in India in 2021: Nityanand Rai
15.article_body: As many as 25,143 foreigners overstayed in the country after their visas expired in 2021, Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai told Parliament on Tuesday. "The overall number of overstaying foreigners from the period prior to 2019 and up to 31st December 2021 is 3,93,431," Rai said in a written reply.

16.title: After 'Kurup' & 'FIR', Vijay's 'Beast' gets banned in Kuwait: Report
16.article_body: Actor Vijay's film 'Beast' has reportedly been banned by the Ministry of Information in Kuwait. "Reason could be portrayal of Pakistan, terrorists or violence," film trade analyst Ramesh Bala tweeted. Recently, Dulquer Salmaan's 'Kurup' and Vishnu Vishal's 'FIR' were banned in Kuwait. "Kuwait [censorship] is becoming very strict in GCC compared to other countries in the region," Ramesh added.

17.title: US punishing 'disobedient' Imran Khan over Moscow visit: Russia
17.article_body: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Pakistan, the Russian Foreign Ministry issued a statement, accusing the US of intervening in the country's internal affairs. It said that the US decided to punish "disobedient" Imran Khan over his visit to Moscow. Khan met Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow on February 24, the day when Russia launched an invasion of Ukraine.

18.title: Krushna trolls Archana for not being part of The Kapil Sharma Show's US tour
18.article_body: Archana Puran Singh shared a video with comedian-actor Krushna Abhishek, where he teases her for not joining 'The Kapil Sharma' team on their US tour. "Archana ji ko nahi le ke jaa rahe." (We aren't taking Archana ji). Reacting to it, Archana jokingly said they aren't taking her to save money. She captioned the video, "Behind the scenes masti (fun)."

19.title: Denmark expels 15 Russian diplomats over security concerns
19.article_body: Denmark on Tuesday expelled 15 Russian 'intelligence officers' it said were serving as diplomats. "We will not accept...Russian intelligence officers...spying on Danish soil," Danish Foreign Minister Jeppe Kofod said. Notably, the move comes amid reports of atrocities by Russian troops in Ukraine's Bucha, following which, Italy, Germany and France announced expulsion of several Russian diplomats.

20.title: Making coffee easier than bowling in powerplay in India: RCB's Willey
20.article_body: Asked to choose between making coffee and bowling in the powerplay in India, RCB all-rounder David Willey said the former is easier. Willey, who was bought by the Bengaluru-based franchise for ₹2 crore, registered bowling figures of 3-0-28-0 and 2-0-7-0 in his side's two matches so far in IPL 2022. RCB will face RR today at Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai.

21.title: European Commission Prez to visit Kyiv this week to meet Zelenskyy
21.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will travel to Kyiv this week for a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, an European Union (EU) spokesman tweeted on Tuesday. She will be accompanied by EU's top diplomat Josep Borrell on the trip. European Parliament President Roberta Metsola had visited Kyiv last week.

22.title: Hyd civic body launches scheme offering 5% rebate on property tax
22.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation has launched an early bird scheme through which people can avail a 5% rebate on property tax. Municipal Administration Department's Director N Satyanarayana said the scheme will apply to those who pay property tax by April 30. Reportedly, GHMC received ₹13.9 crore in two days from 34,540 people who paid property taxes online through the scheme.

23.title: Will hold such events across Maha: Aaditya at Pune Alternate Fuel Conclave
23.article_body: Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray, while speaking at Pune Alternate Fuel Conclave, on Tuesday said more such events will be held across the state. "The green industry is going to take a huge jump and we can lead the world in that. Creating revenue for our country and jobs for people," Thackeray said at the conclave.

24.title: TN Cong leader, who said Rahul & Priyanka should step aside, sacked
24.article_body: Tamil Nadu Congress spokesperson Americai V Narayanan, who said Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi should step aside to save Congress, has been sacked, reports said on Tuesday. "I love Rahul Gandhi but unfortunately, he has not delivered," he said. He also urged Congress to bring back former leaders like Mamata Banerjee, Jagan Mohan Reddy, Sharad Pawar and K Chandrashekar Rao.

25.title: RRR writer Vijayendra says film will have possible sequel: Sreenivasa
25.article_body: Telugu film producer Sreenivasa Kumar, who attended the success party of 'RRR', took to Twitter and said the 'RRR' writer KV Vijayendra Prasad has hinted at the film's sequel. "'RRR' will be a franchise and possible sequel says writer Vijayendra," Sreenivasa tweeted. The success party, attended by Jr NTR and Ram Charan, was hosted by producers Dil Raju and Shirish.

26.title: Rohit has been a fun captain in IPL: MI all-rounder Tim David
26.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma, MI all-rounder Tim David said he's been a fun captain in IPL 2022. "I've only played two games with him, so just getting used to playing with him. Getting used to playing with lots of guys in the team, but we'll find our feet," he added. MI have two losses from two matches so far.

27.title: 2 men steal 15 Llyod ACs from Ahmedabad godown, arrested
27.article_body: Two men have been arrested by the Ahmedabad Police's Detection of Crime Branch (DCB) for stealing 15 air conditioners from a factory godown in Naroda. Police said that the accused Sabyasachi Pal and Mehul More, both 20-years-old, were arrested with a rickshaw that had the air conditioners that they had stolen in November last year.

28.title: MP CM launches scheme to give loans up to ₹50 lakh for self-employment
28.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday launched the 'Udyam Kranti Yojana' in order to facilitate self-employment for the youth. Under the scheme, a loan guarantee of ₹1 lakh to ₹50 lakh will be provided with subsidies on interest rate for self-employment. Around one lakh youth are expected to benefit from the scheme in the financial year 2022-23.

29.title: Fuel price hike in India is 1/10th of price hike in other countries: HS Puri
29.article_body: Fuel prices hike in India is one-tenth of the price hike in other countries, Petroleum Minister HS Puri said in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday. "Comparing gasoline (petrol) prices between April 2021 and March 22, the prices in the US have increased by 51%, Canada 52%, Germany 55%, UK 55%, France 50%, Spain 58% but in India 5%," said Puri.

30.title: 2 held for threatening gay man with his sex video in Coimbatore
30.article_body: Two private college students were arrested for allegedly extorting money from a man by making him involved in a homosexual act and recording it in Coimbatore. According to the police, the accused, aged 19 and 22, had snatched a mobile phone and cash from the complainant. They also threatened to circulate the sex video if the complainant approached the police.

31.title: Wasn't allowed to put lipstick, thought life will be set on becoming actor: Rupali
31.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly said that her mother was strict and did not allow the actress to wear lipstick. She added that wearing lipstick was a big deal for her and she thought her life would be set if she became an actor. She added that she thought the director and other crew members worked hard and actors have it easy.

32.title: Bharti documents her baby's birth journey, fan says 'You're a strong woman'
32.article_body: Comedienne-host Bharti Singh and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa, who welcomed their son on Sunday, shared a video on their YouTube channel LOL (Life of Limbachiyaa's). In the video, Bharti documented her baby's entire birth journey starting from when they went to the doctor to the last day of Bharti's pregnancy. Reacting to it, a user commented, "You're a strong woman."

33.title: Shot for a difficult climax right after my cancer treatment: Sanjay on KGF 2
33.article_body: Ahead of the release of 'KGF 2', actor Sanjay Dutt spoke about the "difficult climax" he shot right after his cancer treatment. "The climax had to be mounted on a large scale. It was a difficult climax, there was mud, dust, fire and a lot of action," Sanjay said. He added that the makers did everything to make him comfortable.

34.title: India has 1.96 nurses per 1,000 population at present: Govt
34.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said India, at present, has 1.96 nurses per 1,000 population with 33.41 lakh registered nursing personnel. He added that the country's doctor-population ratio is 1:834 with 13.01 lakh allopathic doctors and 5.65 lakh AYUSH doctors. Undergraduate seats in medical colleges have increased from 51,348 before 2014 to 89,875 in 2022, he added.

35.title: Over 10 lakh Olive Ridley turtles arrive at 2 major nesting sites in Odisha
35.article_body: Over 10 lakh Olive Ridley turtles have arrived at two major mass nesting sites in Odisha this year. According to officials, a record of over 5.5 lakh turtles congregated at Rushikulya estuary, whereas around five lakh turtles arrived at Gahirmatha Marine Sanctuary in Kendrapara. "We can't say why more turtles preferred Rushikulya rookery. It's a natural phenomenon," an official said.

36.title: Omicron sub-variant BA.2 makes up 72% of COVID cases in US: CDC
36.article_body: Omicron BA.2 sub-variant now makes up 72.2% of the COVID cases in the US, up from nearly 57.3% in the past week, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said. However, the overall COVID-19 infections in America have dropped sharply after hitting record levels in January. According to WHO, BA.2 now makes up about 86% of all cases globally.

37.title: Delhi govt's step-motherly behaviour hinders working of 3 MCDs: Shah
37.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday alleged that the Delhi government's "step-motherly behaviour" hinders the efficient working of all three municipal corporations. "If state governments behave in a step-motherly fashion with civic bodies, neither Panchayati Raj nor urban local bodies will be successful," Shah added. He was speaking in Rajya Sabha on the Bill to merge the civic bodies.

38.title: Kashmir Files crosses ₹300 cr at worldwide box office, director shares post
38.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' has earned ₹331 crore at the worldwide box office. He took to Twitter on Monday to share the news and wrote, "Thanks to all Indians all over the world in helping #TheKashmirFiles tell the truth to the world." It stars Mithun Chakraborty, Pallavi Joshi and Anupam Kher among others in pivotal roles.

39.title: Nobody pushing Pant to get ton in ODIs; 40s, 50s are fine: Rathour
39.article_body: Team India batting coach Vikram Rathour said nobody is pushing Rishabh Pant to get a century in ODIs, terming it as fine if he can consistently score 40s, 50s. "Nobody wants him not to play his shots, we just want him to be more selective in picking the bowlers," added Rathour. Pant is yet to score his maiden ODI ton.

40.title: Hope Williamson will play in the England Test series: NZ coach Gary Stead
40.article_body: New Zealand coach Gary Stead said he is hopeful of captain Kane Williamson featuring in the Test series against England in June but emphasises being "smart" while managing his workload. "He's (Williamson) dying to play cricket for New Zealand...but we can't burn him out...We have to be smart around those things," Stead said while referring to Williamson's recent elbow injury.

41.title: Hybrid security to be evolved at establishments where CISF is deployed: Govt
41.article_body: The Centre informed the Lok Sabha that hybrid models of security will be evolved to provide security at establishments where the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) is deployed. "There is no proposal under consideration to train and certify private security agencies across the country by CISF," MoS for Home Nityanand Rai said.

42.title: Petrol prices reach ₹110.25/litre in B'luru as fuel rates hiked again
42.article_body: Fuel prices were hiked again across the country for the 13th time in 15 days on Tuesday. Following the latest price revision, the price of petrol has reached ₹110.25 per litre in Bengaluru, while that of diesel has reached ₹94.01 per litre. Meanwhile, Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission has hiked electricity tariffs by five paise per unit across the state.

43.title: After SRK & Sanjay, Notebook actor Zaheer Iqbal receives UAE's Golden Visa
43.article_body: Zaheer Iqbal, who was seen in Salman Khan-backed film 'Notebook', took to Instagram to announce that he has received the UAE's Golden Visa. The visa will stay valid for 10 years and will allow him to work and live in the country without a national sponsor. Actors who've been granted Golden Visa include Shah Rukh Khan, Sanjay Dutt and Mammootty.

44.title: I have seen bodies frozen due to being burned: Ram Charan on Russia-Ukraine war
44.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said he has seen bodies frozen due to being burned in videos sent by Rusty, who was his security-in-charge while shooting for 'RRR' in Ukraine. "The videos were dreadful. If you touch [the bodies] probably they will turn into ashes," added Ram. "Rusty burst out crying," stated Ram. "I keep texting him...to pep him up," said Ram.

45.title: Indian pair of Manika, Archana enter top 5 in TT world rankings
45.article_body: India's women's doubles pair of Manika Batra and Archana Girish Kamath have moved up to the fourth spot (women's doubles category) in the latest world rankings issued by the International Table Tennis Federation. The two places' jump in the world rankings is due to the duo's performance in the WTT Star Contender Doha 2022 where they won a bronze medal.

46.title: 99% of world’s population now breathes polluted air: WHO
46.article_body: Almost the entire global population is breathing polluted air, the World Health Organization (WHO) warned on Monday. The WHO data revealed that 99% of people in the world are inhaling unhealthy levels of fine particulate matter and nitrogen dioxide (NO2) that threaten their health. People living in low and middle-income countries have been suffering the highest exposures, the data stated.

47.title: Videos of Zakir Naik found in laptop of Gorakhnath temple attacker: Police
47.article_body: The UP Police's Anti-Terrorism Squad found videos of radical Muslim preacher Zakir Naik and violence in Syria in the laptop recovered from the 29-year-old man who attacked two policemen outside Gorakhnath temple on Sunday. The attack is a part of a "serious conspiracy" and could be termed a "terror incident" based on evidence collected so far, the police added.

48.title: Rachakonda Police seizes 46,500 litres of illegal diesel, arrests 6
48.article_body: The official Twitter handle of Rachakonda Police shared that an illegal diesel mafia has been busted in the city. The post further said that police has arrested six persons and seized 46,500 litres of illegal diesel from their possession. Notably, the price of petrol has reached ₹118.59 per litre in Hyderabad, while that of diesel has reached ₹104.62 per litre.

49.title: Once wanted to make Rohit bhai happy, he abused me on the field: Ishan Kishan
49.article_body: MI wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan revealed he once wanted to make captain Rohit Sharma happy by trying to make the ball old by rolling it on ground during a match in his first IPL season. "I rolled it...but there was dew...He took out his towel and abused me," Ishan said. "He later said, 'Don't take it personally...it's just match-to-match'," he added.

50.title: Won't get scared even if I'm shot: Raut as ED attaches his properties
50.article_body: Senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said he won't get scared even if he is shot or sent to jail. His reaction came after ED attached properties linked to him in connection to an alleged ₹1,034 land scam case. He claimed he doesn't even own one acre of land in Alibaug and purchased properties with his hard-earned money.

51.title: Becoming someone on whom one can rely: KL Rahul on Deepak Hooda
51.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants skipper KL Rahul has said that Deepak Hooda is "becoming" a reliable middle-order batter after the latter scored 51 runs off 33 balls against the Sunrisers Hyderabad on Monday. "I've been playing with Hooda for the last 3-4 seasons...He had to wait for his chance...and now is becoming someone you can rely on," Rahul said.

52.title: Airbnb clarifies it's not suspending Russians from making reservations
52.article_body: Airbnb has clarified that it's not banning Russian and Belarusian nationals from making reservations on its platform. Earlier, the platform had said guests located in Russia or Belarus will not be able to make new reservations on Airbnb. Some users interpreted the statement, which was made in Russian, to mean the policy applied to all Russian and Belarusian nationals globally.

53.title: Fish can perform addition and subtraction, finds study
53.article_body: Cichlid and stingray fish species can perform simple calculations in numbers ranging from one to five, a study stated. Researchers trained them to perform simple additions and subtractions by increasing or decreasing an initial value by one. They can also be trained to detect smaller quantities without counting. It's, however, not known what these fish need their mathematical abilities for.

54.title: Mesmerising sight: Aaditya Thackeray on Pune college's boat show
54.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray said the 94th Regatta (boat show) organised by the College of Engineering Pune (COEP) was "a mesmerising sight". "It's a fantastic event with a mix of sports and grace," Thackeray said. "Wow, so nice to see a regatta after so many years. Once upon a time, I was also a participant," a Twitter user commented.

55.title: Undermines women empowerment: NCW on textbook listing merits of dowry
55.article_body: The National Commission for Women (NCW) has written to Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan seeking remedial action against the sociology textbook for nurses which listed merits of dowry. Calling dowry a social evil in India, NCW said portraying it in a positive way would undermine women empowerment. "It sends very wrong message to...students about prevailing menace of dowry," the NCW said.

56.title: My father went to hospital to get his BP checked: Ishan Kishan on IPL 2018 auction
56.article_body: Recalling IPL 2018 auction wherein he was bought by MI for ₹6.2 crore, Ishan Kishan said when he went home after receiving the news, his father wasn't there. "I asked my mother, 'Where is dad?' She said, 'He has gone to hospital to get his BP checked'," Ishan said. "I was thinking 'What has happened to my family?'" Ishan added.

57.title: US author who wrote 'How to murder your husband' essay accused of killing husband
57.article_body: A 71-year-old US-based romance novelist is accused of fatally shooting her husband in June 2018 to get more than $1.5 million in life insurance. Nancy Crampton-Brophy had written an essay entitled 'How to murder your husband' in 2011. "The thing I know about murder is that everyone...has it in him/her (to murder) when pushed far enough," the essay reportedly said.

58.title: Elephants can dance as well: HDFC Bank's CEO on merger with HDFC
58.article_body: HDFC Bank's CEO Sashidhar Jagdishan, who will lead the merged entity of HDFC Bank and HDFC, said, "Elephants can dance as well." When asked about the next milestone, Jagdishan said, "We don't work for any milestones." He added, "Even if I'm not there...this engine created by the founding fathers...it's such a fantastic platform that it will grow on its own."

59.title: Yami shares jail inmate's story who prepared career options for his daughter
59.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam, who'll be seen as a cop in 'Dasvi', shared the story of a jail inmate that stayed with her. She said, "One inmate...sent his register...for an autograph and with a picture of his daughter." Yami added that he prepared different career options in the register for his daughter including that of an IAS officer and a banker.

60.title: Had released 'Aankhen' with 2 different endings in India & abroad: Director
60.article_body: Vipul Shah's directorial 'Aankhen', which featured Amitabh Bachchan, Akshay Kumar and Sushmita Sen, has completed 20 years of its release today.  Vipul revealed that they had released the film with "two different endings in India and abroad". "Overseas print had an open-end...I was told, India isn't ready for such open-ended stories as...concept of sequel didn't exist back then," he added.

61.title: Maxwell won't play vs RR due to Cricket Australia's clause: RCB coach Hesson
61.article_body: RCB head coach Mike Hesson has said Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell won't be available for their match against RR on Tuesday and will only be available from their next game onwards. Hesson explained that while Maxwell has joined the camp, he can't play before Australia complete their tour of Pakistan. Australia will play their last T20I against Pakistan on Tuesday.

62.title: Blessed it happened when young as I can recover: Hooda on Krunal spat
62.article_body: Discussing his spat with Krunal Pandya while playing for Baroda in 2021, Deepak Hooda said, "I am blessed that it all happened at a young age because then you can recover as well [as] learn a lot." Both Hooda and Krunal are representing LSG in IPL 2022. They were seen hugging each other in LSG's IPL 2022 opener against GT.

63.title: Italy expels 30 Russian diplomats citing security concerns
63.article_body: Italy reportedly expelled 30 Russian diplomats citing security concerns amid the ongoing war in Ukraine. "The measure is in agreement with other European and Atlantic partners and is necessary for reasons linked to our national security," said the country's Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio. The Italian government reportedly summoned the Russian ambassador to inform him about the expulsion.

64.title: ByteDance scraped content from Instagram, Snapchat for older app: Report
64.article_body: TikTok-parent ByteDance made fake accounts with content scraped from Instagram, Snapchat and other such platforms and used them on Flipagram, a TikTok predecessor, in 2017, BuzzFeed News reported citing four former employees of the company. The scraping was seen as a "growth hack" for the company. ByteDance's goal was to scrape more than 10,000 videos a day, a source said.

65.title: 13-yr-old girl writes poems on death, dies by suicide in Maha
65.article_body: A 13-year-old girl died by suicide at her residence in Maharashtra's Nagpur after writing poems and quotes on death, police said on Tuesday. Police found a notebook in her bedroom, in which she had been writing poems on death in Marathi and English for the last two months. The incident occurred at 1 pm on Monday, reports said.

66.title: Hungary PM must choose between Russia & other world: Zelenskyy
66.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Hungarian PM Viktor Orban will have to choose between Moscow and the "other world" following his election victory on Sunday. Zelenskyy accused Orban of fearing Russian influence. Orban has for years maintained close ties with Russian President Vladimir Putin. The Russian leader had also congratulated Orban after his party won a fourth term in office.

67.title: 4 arrested in UP for posing as magistrates and trying to see question papers
67.article_body: The Agra Police arrested four people who entered a school posing as magistrates and sought to inspect a secure room where question papers of UP Board examinations were kept, an official said. "They asked police and centre manager to take them to strong room...When asked, they were not able to prove their identity and provide authorisation letter," the police informed.

68.title: Germany warns its Russian speakers of disinformation on Ukraine war
68.article_body: Germany has warned Russian speakers in the country against Kremlin's 'disinformation' amid the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine. Russian speakers in Germany should "inform themselves comprehensively with national and international media", German government official Wolfgang Büchner said. His remarks came after Kremlin alleged that the killing of civilians in Ukraine's Bucha had been staged.

69.title: Woman recovers from vertebra fracture after neurosurgery in Hyd
69.article_body: The doctors at Hyderabad's Century Hospital successfully performed minimal invasive neurosurgery to help a 60-year-old woman recover from a fracture in the lower vertebra. She was reportedly suffering from severe back pain after a fall incident. The doctors performed a vertebroplasty procedure on her, under which bone cement is injected into the backbones (vertebrae) that have cracked or broken.

70.title: Bird population in tropical forests drops by 90% in 40 years: Study
70.article_body: According to research, the number of birds living in tropical forests declined by up to 90% in the last 40 years. Researchers recorded a decline in the number of 40 species amounting to 70% of the total bird population. Moreover, 35 species declined to at least half of their initial numbers. Only the hummingbird and puffbird populations saw a rise.

71.title: Indian composer Ricky Kej touches co-winner's feet at Grammys, Raveena praises him
71.article_body: Indian composer Ricky Kej won his second Grammy when he and collaborator Stewart Copeland won Best New Age Album at 64th Annual Grammy Awards. Actress Raveena Tandon shared a video where Ricky is seen touching Stewart's feet on stage. "So so proud. Brings the divinity of our culture on an international stage...Pays respect to his guru. #proudtobeindian," she wrote.

72.title: Nagaland's 1st woman Rajya Sabha MP takes oath in traditional attire, jewellery
72.article_body: S Phangnon Konyak, the President of BJP Nagaland Mahila Morcha, took oath in the Rajya Sabha wearing her traditional Naga clothes and jewellery on Monday. She is the first woman from the state to get a berth in Parliament's Upper House. The 44-year-old leader was elected unopposed as the Rajya Sabha member from Nagaland on March 31.

73.title: Water cannons used on AAP water tariff hike protesters in Chandigarh
73.article_body: The police on Tuesday used water cannons to disperse a protest against the increase in water tariff in Chandigarh by AAP workers. The party tweeted a video of the incident and accused the BJP of making things costlier after "fraudulently" getting a Mayor of the BJP party. The protesters had been moving towards the Union Territory's Municipal Corporation office.

74.title: All practices in compliance with law: Zomato after CCI orders probe
74.article_body: Zomato issued a statement after the Competition Commission of India ordered an investigation into the conduct of Swiggy and Zomato. It said while CCI has prima facie didn't find concerns with respect to their independence on levy of commissions or alleged bundling of services, it'll work to assist them and explain why their services are in compliance with the law.

75.title: 10,600 km road network ready in Naxal-hit areas: Nityanand Rai
75.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai said 10, 600 kilometres of roads have been constructed in Left Wing Extremism (LWE) or Naxal-affected areas at an expenditure of around ₹13,000 crore. Over 16,200 kilometres of roads have been approved in such areas, he added. "The number of districts reporting violence...reduced...from 96% in 2010 to 46% in 2021," Rai added.

76.title: Tamil Nadu man builds ₹80,000 statue of his dog who died last year
76.article_body: An 82-year-old retired government employee has built a statue in the memory of his dog named Tom who died in 2021 in the Sivaganga district of Tamil Nadu. The man has spent ₹80,000 on the statue. "Tom was with me since 2010 but he died in 2021," the man said, adding that they offer food to the statue.

77.title: Punjab’s resolution on Chandigarh is unconstitutional: Cong’s Deepender Hooda
77.article_body: Congress leader Deepender Singh Hooda termed Punjab’s resolution on Chandigarh as "unconstitutional". "The resolution of Punjab over Chandigarh is in violation of the Act under which Punjab, Haryana and Himachal Pradesh were formed in the year 1966," Hooda said. "Punjab has suppressed the water of Haryana’s share, even after the Supreme Court’s decision in favour of Haryana," Hooda stated.

78.title: 3 booked for abetting suicide of 23-yr-old man in Gurugram
78.article_body: The Government Railway Police (GRP) on Monday said that three men have been booked for abetting the suicide of a 23-year-old man in Gurugram. The man had jumped in front of a train on April 2, according to the police. The victim's family has claimed that he killed himself after being forced into peddling drugs by the accused.

79.title: Bombay HC asks Ola, Uber to comply with Motor Vehicle Aggregator Guidelines
79.article_body: The Bombay High Court directed the cab aggregators, including Uber India and Ola, to comply with the conditions laid down in the Motor Vehicle Aggregator Guidelines (MVAG) 2020. The court's directions were given to those firms that have been granted provisional licenses. The bench said that the MVAG-2020 will be applicable until the Maharashtra Regulation of Aggregator Rules-2021 is approved.

80.title: Even Sachin took time to score his first ODI ton: Kiran More on Pant
80.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant who is yet to score his maiden century in ODIs, ex-India wicketkeeper Kiran More said even Sachin Tendulkar took time to score his maiden ODI hundred. "There will be times when you smash your head and say, 'Why did Pant play that shot?', but...we need to be ready to accept that," Rohit Sharma had recently said.

81.title: NTR30 is loaded with drama, will live up post RRR expectations: Jr NTR
81.article_body: Jr NTR, talking about his upcoming film with director Koratala Siva, said, "It's going to be loaded with drama because...drama sells a lot." Jr NTR's film with Koratala is tentatively named 'NTR30'. He added 'NTR30' will have everything that the audience expects after the release of 'RRR'. Speaking about 'NTR31' with director Prashanth Neel, he called it a wonderful project.

82.title: Figuring out how MS Dhoni's mind works really stressed me out: Kishan
82.article_body: Ishan Kishan said he keeps trying to figure out how MS Dhoni's mind works, adding that attempting to do so really stressed him out in an IPL match. "I was playing well...But then Dhoni bhai walked up to the bowler and said something. And in my mind, I'm wondering what Dhoni bhai has told him," stated Kishan.

83.title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Nazara to invest ₹18 cr in US-based Bitkraft Ventures
83.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Nazara Technologies will invest over ₹18 crore in US-based game fund Bitkraft Ventures. Nazara will invest ₹6.5 crore upfront, while the balance investment amount of ₹12.2 crore will be deployed over a period of three years. Earlier in March, Nazara Technologies had announced its commitment to invest ₹30 crore into Griffin Gaming Partners' Fund ll.

84.title: HAL hands over first set of Gaganyaan hardware to ISRO
84.article_body: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) on Monday handed over the first set of Gaganyaan hardware to Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) in Bengaluru. "HAL has and will continue to play a significant role in India's current and future space programme including the Gaganyaan manned mission to space, given the skills and knowledge base within the company," said ISRO Chairman S Somanath.

85.title: Mumbai man sexually abuses 4 minor boys after offering money for 'falooda'
85.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested for allegedly sexually abusing four minor boys in Mumbai between March 24 and 31. Police said the man allegedly lured the boys under the pretext of giving them each ₹50 to have 'falooda' (dessert). The accused, who is a relative of one of the boys, allegedly took the nine-year-old to his room and molested him.

86.title: Military situation in Mariupol is very difficult: Ukraine Prez
86.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that the military situation in the southern port city of Mariupol is "very difficult". Zelenskyy added that Turkey had proposed a plan to help evacuate injured people and dead bodies from the city, but warned the initiative depended on his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin's will. Reportedly, around 1,30,000 people are stuck in Mariupol.

87.title: ED attaches assets worth ₹4.8 crore linked to AAP's Satyendar Jain
87.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached assets worth ₹4.81 crore linked to Delhi Minister and AAP leader Satyendar Jain in a disproportionate assets case. The investigation revealed that during 2015-16, certain companies beneficially owned and controlled by Jain received accommodation entries from shell companies against cash transferred through hawala route. Further investigation is underway.

88.title: PM asks BJP lawmakers to create awareness about govt schemes
88.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has asked ruling BJP lawmakers to attend the fortnight-long programmes from April 7 to create awareness about the government’s "social justice" and "people-centric" policies. A BJP functionary said the lawmakers and ministers have been asked to create awareness about 14 central schemes at the local level.

89.title: Mumbai man injured in fight over parking spot, gets 20 stitches
89.article_body: A man in Mumbai received as many as 20 stitches after getting involved in a fight over a parking spot for a two-wheeler on Friday in Mumbai's Santacruz. "The fight started after one Imtiyaz Baig asked Farhan Sheikh to remove his motorcycle from the lane, with families of both men getting involved," police said. Two brothers have been arrested.

90.title: 5 killed, several injured as van crashes into train in Hungary
90.article_body: Five people were killed and at least 10 injured on Tuesday after a van crashed into a train in Hungary. The authorities said all of the deceased victims were travelling in the van. The train, with 22 people onboard, derailed due to the collision. They added that the van carrying local workers drove onto the tracks while ignoring red lights.

91.title: 3 killed, 30 injured as double-decker bus overturns in UP; CM expresses grief
91.article_body: Three persons were killed and 30 sustained injuries when a double-decker bus overturned on the Lucknow-Gorakhpur national highway in Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday morning while trying to overtake another vehicle, police said. CM Yogi Adityanath has expressed condolences to the bereaved families. He also directed speedy relief and rescue efforts by sending the District Magistrate and SSP to the spot.

92.title: If you don't get Buttler out early, he'll take the game away: Morkel
92.article_body: Ahead of RR's match against RCB, ex-SA pacer Morne Morkel said RR batter Jos Buttler is one of those batters who'll take the game away if you don't get him out early in the match. "Sometimes the bowling unit needs to say it's his day and enjoy the show," added Morkel. Buttler scored 100(68) in RR's last game against MI.

93.title: Russia says Wikipedia could be fined over 'false' info on Ukraine
93.article_body: Russia has said that Wikipedia can be fined up to $48,120 for failing to remove "material with inaccurate information of public interest" about the situation in Ukraine. Earlier, the Wikimedia Foundation said it will "not back down" after Russia threatened to block Wikipedia's Russian-language site covering Ukraine's invasion. It said Russia's takedown request threatens censorship.

94.title: PWD to install LED lights on 8.5 km stretch from Mayapuri to Moti Bagh
94.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department has decided to remove the dark spots on an 8.5 kilometre stretch from Mayapuri to Moti Bagh junction with high-tech automatic LED lights. "The stretch will have cycle tracks. Music speakers have been installed so more people use this stretch and women do not feel unsafe," said a senior PWD official.

95.title: Officials seek 5 new lifts, 2 ramps at Pune railway station
95.article_body: Pune's railway division officials have sent a proposal to railway headquarters seeking installation of five lifts and two ramps at station for convenience of disabled and elderly commuters. According to proposal, two lifts will be installed on first platform, while the rest will be installed on five other platforms. The ramps will be attached to a newly-constructed foot-over-bridge at station.

96.title: Dearness Allowance for Karnataka govt employees hiked by 2.75% to 27.25%
96.article_body: The Karnataka government on Tuesday announced a 2.75% hike in the Dearness Allowance (DA) payable to its employees in the revised 2018 pay scales and under the seventh pay commission. Employees will now get 27.25% DA with effect from January 1 this year. This comes days after PM Narendra Modi approved a 3% hike in DA for central government employees.

97.title: Girl named 'Madhu ka Panchwa Baccha' on Aadhaar denied school admission in UP
97.article_body: A girl in Uttar Pradesh was denied admission to a government school as her Aadhaar card carried her name as "Madhu ka Panchwa Baccha" and "Baby Five of Madhu". While a photo of her card went viral online, the District Magistrate said it was a mistake caused by gross negligence and strict action will be taken against those involved.

98.title: Kangana loses cool at paparazzi for waiting outside her home, says 'Stop it'
98.article_body: Kangana Ranaut lost her cool at paparazzi, who were waiting outside her home to click her pictures. In a video shared by a paparazzo on Instagram, Kangana can be seen getting out of her car. However, she declined to pose for the shutterbugs and asked them to leave. She said, "Will you come here every day now? Stop it."

99.title: Row over loudspeakers at mosques will backfire BJP in elections: Siddaramaiah
99.article_body: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah criticised the BJP-led Karnataka government and said that the Karnataka BJP is "manipulating society with communal issues for their political gains" because the Assembly elections are nearing. "This will backfire BJP in coming days. Speakers are installed in temples, mosques and churches for a long time now. What harm did it cause to people?" Siddaramaiah added.

100.title: Maha BJP leader offers to fund speakers to counter Azaan with Hanuman Chalisa
100.article_body: Maharashtra BJP leader Mohit Kamboj has offered to fund speakers to counter Azaan with Hanuman Chalisa. "Anyone who needs a loudspeaker...can ask us for free!" he said. This comes after MNS leader Raj Thackeray urged the state government to remove loudspeakers from mosques and added that if it was not done, he would play Hanuman Chalisa on speakers.

101.title: 18-year-old gamer claims headphones saved him from a bullet in US
101.article_body: An 18-year-old gamer from the US claimed on Reddit that his headphones saved his life from a stray bullet. "A stray bullet went through my window and hit the headphones on top of my head," the teenager's post read. "If it wasn't for the headphones made with good quality I would've been a dead kid at 18," the post said.

102.title: Group sex video of female teacher & her students recorded by her lover in TN; arrested
102.article_body: Tamil Nadu Cyber cell has launched an investigation into a group sex video involving a 42-year-old female school teacher and boy students. The video, which was allegedly filmed by a 39-year-old  businessman who was the teacher's lover, had reportedly been shared by his friends. The teacher and her lover have been arrested.

103.title: Even your husband won't be as proud as I am: Satish to Rupali on 'Anupamaa'
103.article_body: Actor Satish Shah said that he is proud of actress Rupali Ganguly for her performance in 'Anupamaa'. "Even your husband or any other family member won't be as proud as me...this is coming straight from my heart...I swear Rupali darling...you are doing...fantastic job...I always knew you were...very fine actor when you had joined us in Sarabhai Vs Sarabhai," Satish added.

104.title: Oscar-winning filmmaker John Zaritsky passes away at 79
104.article_body: Oscar-winning filmmaker John Zaritsky passed away aged 79 on March 30 due to heart failure at the Vancouver General Hospital, Canada. He won an Oscar in the Best Documentary Feature category for 'Just Another Missing Kid'. Zaritsky's work has been broadcast in 35 countries and screened at more than 40 film festivals around the world, including Sundance and Toronto.

105.title: Ranveer's performance in Jayeshbhai Jordaar 'tour de force': Producer
105.article_body: 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' producer Maneesh Sharma said that actor Ranveer Singh has delivered a 'tour de force' performance in the film, adding that his acting makes him marvel yet again at the artistic heights Ranveer's capable of. "It's always a mix of pride and joy to collaborate with Ranveer. The early promise I sensed in Ranveer has been realised," added Maneesh.

106.title: Unfortunate that Sanju hasn't been able to seal his place in Team India: Akhtar
106.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said it's unfortunate that RR captain Sanju Samson hasn't been able to seal his place in Team India. Akhtar added, "Sanju should play more matches for India, I think he's one of the finest players." Akhtar further said that England batter Jos Buttler's talent has also not been recognised yet.

107.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann announces task force to deal with gangsters
107.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday ordered the formation of an anti-gangster task force, led by an officer of the Additional Director General of Police rank, to deal with gangs in the state. The task force will be formed to combat organised crime and it will have an integrated collection of intelligence, manning and execution of operations, officials said.

108.title: Objective of Criminal Procedure Bill is to protect citizens' human rights: Amit Shah
108.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill has been brought with the objective to protect the human rights of crores of law-abiding citizens. "Its sole objective is to improve the conviction rate in the country…Send a strong message in society," Shah added. "It had not been brought for any misuse," Shah stated.

109.title: Jadeja has given headache to Dhoni to look after field setting and everything: Harbhajan
109.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has said that he feels that MS Dhoni is still the captain of CSK. "Jadeja has given headache to MS Dhoni to look after the field setting and everything [when he goes and fields outside the ring]," Harbhajan stated. "Jadeja needs to stand up and talk about a few things," Harbhajan added.

110.title: Former Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal diagnosed with prostate cancer
110.article_body: Ex-Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal said that he is receiving treatment for prostate cancer. The 70-year-old, who is currently in charge of the Netherlands national team, made the announcement on Dutch TV programme Humberto. Manchester United tweeted, "Everybody at Manchester United is fully behind our former manager...in his battle against cancer. Sending you strength and courage, Louis."

111.title: West staged mass killings in Ukraine's Bucha to discredit us: Russia
111.article_body: The mass killings of civilians in Ukraine's Bucha are part of a deceitful attempt by the West to "discredit Russia", Vyacheslav Volodin, Speaker of Russia's lower house of Parliament, said. "Washington and Brussels are the screenwriters, directors and Kyiv are the actors," Volodin added. Bucha Mayor Anatoliy Fedoruk on Saturday said that nearly 300 civilians were killed by Russian forces.

112.title: 1 lakh methamphetamine tablets worth ₹30 crore seized in Mizoram
112.article_body: Crime Investigation Department (CID) seized one lakh tablets of methamphetamine worth ₹30 crore in Mizoram's Aizawl, police said. The CID team raided the Zohnuai area in the Vaivakawn neighbourhood following a tip-off. The tablets were seized from the possession of a woman peddler, a resident of Farkawn village in Champhai district bordering Myanmar, police added.

113.title: Jason Momoa to star in historical drama 'Chief of War'
113.article_body: Jason Momoa is set to star in Apple's historical drama 'Chief of War'. The 'Aquaman' star is also attached to write and executive produce the limited series. The series follows the story of the unification and colonisation of Hawaii from an indigenous point of view, Variety reported. Jason will also be seen in 'Aquaman 2' and 'Fast & Furious 10'.

114.title: I wouldn't pick Warner in DC's playing XI against LSG: Hogg
114.article_body: Brad Hogg said he'll not include Australia opener David Warner in DC's playing XI against LSG on Thursday, even if he's available and will choose Tim Seifert instead. "I would want more right-handers to face Ravi Bishnoi as he's very dominant against left-handers with his wrong ones," he added. Warner joined DC camp late due to Australia's series in Pakistan.

115.title: B'luru woman who collapsed in gym died of cerebral haemorrhage: Autopsy
115.article_body: The post-mortem report of a 35-year-old woman who died after collapsing while working out at a Bengaluru-based gym has revealed the cause of death. According to the report, her death was caused by a cerebral haemorrhage, which was the result of a blood vessel rupture caused by stress in the brain. Footage of the woman collapsing was captured on CCTV.

116.title: Sanjay Raut's properties attached by ED in ₹1,000 cr land scam case
116.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate said on Tuesday that it has attached properties of senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut in connection to the ₹1,034 crore Patra Chawl land scam case. A plot owned by Raut in Alibaug and another flat of his in Mumbai's Dadar were attached. Raut, who is a close aide of Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, tweeted, "Asatyamev wins."

117.title: Govt blocks 22 India, Pak-based YouTube channels for spreading fake news
117.article_body: The government has issued orders to block 22 YouTube news channels, three Twitter accounts, one Facebook account, and one news website. "The...channels...were used to spread fake news, and coordinated disinformation...on subjects sensitive from the perspective of national security," the government said. The blocked YouTube channels include 18 India-based channels and four based in Pakistan.

118.title: Shut meat shops during Navratri, respect sentiments: East Delhi Mayor
118.article_body: East Delhi Mayor Shyam Sunder Aggarwal has urged meat shop owners to close their establishments during Navrati and respect Hindu sentiments. "We don't consume even onion-garlic during Navratri," he added. Further, he said there's a rule that meat shops will remain shut on Saptami, Ashtami and Navami. "If slaughterhouses will be closed, meat will not be sold," he said.

119.title: IIT grad who attacked police in Gorakhpur didn't meet family for 3 yrs: ATS
119.article_body: The IIT-Bombay graduate who attacked two policemen outside the Gorakhnath temple in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur on Sunday did not meet his family for the last three years, the UP ATS said. ATS officials visited Navi Mumbai where the accused, Ahmad Murtaza Abbasi, used to live with his family. UP Police said Abbasi forcibly tried to enter the Gorakhnath temple premises.

120.title: How much are petrol and diesel prices expected to further rise according to experts?
120.article_body: Experts have noted that retail prices of petrol and diesel need to be hiked by ₹0.52-0.60 for every $1/barrel rise in the price of crude oil for oil marketing companies. The price of Brent crude has risen by about $28.4/barrel since November 4 to $108.9/barrel, indicating that fuel prices could see further hikes of ₹5.5-7.8/litre each on petrol and diesel.

121.title: Gets stressful but I'm my fans' baby: Rashmika on living up to expectations
121.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna said that she would be lying if she said that it doesn't get stressful to live up to the expectations of fans. "But I am my fans' baby...I like it when I do something they like...Making them happy is what keeps me going...which keeps me motivated to work harder and keep getting...better at what...I do," she added.

122.title: 9 criminals nabbed in 2 separate shootouts with Noida Police
122.article_body: Noida Police on Monday said that they have arrested nine suspected criminals in two separate shootouts, leaving five of them injured. The accused were involved in theft and kidnappings, according to the police. The police also said that they have recovered four pistols, five knifes, two cars and one bike from their possession.

123.title: H'yana to stay in Chandigarh until money given for new capital: Vij
123.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij has said that the state will "stand firm" in Chandigarh until it gets "one single decision over Sutlej Yamuna Link canal water, Hindi-speaking regions and money from the Centre for establishing a new capital." Earlier, Punjab passed a resolution to transfer Chandigarh to itself. "[Haryana won't] pull back...'Angad ka paer' from Chandigarh," he added.

124.title: 3 killed, 6 injured after bus comes in contact with live wire in Jaisalmer
124.article_body: Three people were killed while six others were injured after a bus came in contact with a live wire in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer on Tuesday. According to ASI Mukesh Beera, the incident occurred on Jaisalmer-Chelak road when the bus was returning from a fair in Guhda village. One person who was critically injured was referred to a Jodhpur hospital, police added.

125.title: J&K students who cheered for Pak still in jail for lack of bail money
125.article_body: Three Kashmiri students, facing sedition charge for celebrating Pakistan's victory over India in the T20 World Cup, are stuck in Agra Central Jail despite getting bail owing to lack of money to pay for the surety deposit. "Their release from jail still seems a distant dream because the court has asked us to deposit ₹6 lakh," said a student's uncle.

126.title: Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt to get married on April 17 at RK Studios: Report
126.article_body: Actors Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt will get married on April 17, as per a report by ETimes. "Alia's grandfather N Razdan wanted to see her getting married to Ranbir...The ceremony will be held at RK Studios and nothing extravagant has been planned yet," the report said while quoting a source. It will reportedly be a close-knit family affair.

127.title: Pic of female sniper called 'Charcoal' surfaces amid war in Ukraine
127.article_body: A picture of Ukrainian female sniper known as 'Charcoal' is being widely shared online, with people calling her a "national hero" amid war with Russia. "We must take them all out. These people are not human beings. Even the fascists were not as vile as these orcs. We must defeat them," she said in a speech.

128.title: Torture chamber used by Russians found in Bucha, 5 corpses found inside: Officials
128.article_body: Authorities in Ukraine said they've discovered a torture chamber in the basement of a children's sanatorium in Bucha. Bodies of five men with their hands tied were also found in the chamber used by Russian troops, they said, adding that their deaths are being investigated as a war crime. Mass graves have also reportedly been found in Bucha.

129.title: Tired of waiting, keeping options open: Son of Cong's Ahmed Patel
129.article_body: Late Congress leader Ahmed Patel's son Faisal Patel, in an apparent reference to the party leadership, on Tuesday said he was tired of waiting around. "No encouragement from...top brass. Keeping my options open," he tweeted. He had earlier said that he will enter electoral politics if Congress asks. Ahmed Patel was a close aide of Congress chief Sonia Gandhi.

130.title: RR's bowling against Plessis, Kohli is going to be a big test for them: Hogg
130.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg has said RR lack pace in their attack and their bowling against RCB's Faf du Plessis and Virat Kohli is going to be a big test for them. "RR are going to be put under extreme pressure...Their bowling is probably their weak link," he added. RR will play against RCB on Tuesday night.

131.title: US seizes $34 million worth of crypto tied to illegal dark web acts
131.article_body: The US government has seized $34 million worth of cryptocurrency tied to illegal dark web activity. The cryptocurrency was seized from a US resident who used an online alias to sell over 100,000 illicit items across marketplaces on the dark web. The majority of the sales are said to be hacked account information from major services including HBO and Netflix.

132.title: Single most annoying problem on Twitter: Elon Musk on crypto scam bots
132.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk, whose 9.2% passive stake in Twitter was disclosed on Monday, said crypto scam bots are the "single most annoying problem on Twitter". He was replying to a Twitter user who suggested that "improving the verification system to prove that you're an actual real human" would help with the problem. Musk is now Twitter's largest shareholder.

133.title: SC to hear electoral bonds case, says would've heard earlier if not for COVID
133.article_body: Supreme Court has agreed to urgently hear pleas challenging the laws on the issuance of electoral bonds. "Had it not been for COVID-19, the court would have heard the case earlier," CJI NV Ramana said. Advocate Prashant Bhushan cited a report before the SC stating that a Calcutta-based company paid ₹40 crore through electoral bonds to bypass excise related issues.

134.title: Peers gave idiotic advice, parents told me not to listen to bulls**t: Vivaan
134.article_body: Actor Vivaan Shah said he made the mistake of chasing stardom and success early in his career and he wishes he would have had listened to his parents. "My peers...and my friends were filling my head...with all kinds of idiotic advice...I must be like this to be a star or leading man...My parents told me...not to listen to...bullsh**t," he added.

135.title: I have miserably failed with regular love stories: John Abraham
135.article_body: John Abraham said he has miserably failed when he has done a regular love story, adding that he has not acted in a love story that is different for a long time. Discussing his untitled upcoming film with director Abhishek Sharma, John stated, "You'll scratch your head and think, 'What were you thinking when you decided to do this?'"

136.title: No alliance with TRS in Telangana: Rahul tells state Cong leaders
136.article_body: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has told the Telangana Congress leaders in a meeting at his Delhi residence that there will be "no alliance" with TRS for the next year's state elections. "We held a discussion with Rahul ji over various issues...He will visit Telangana this month. No alliance...Congress will fight against TRS and BJP," said PCC chief Revanth Reddy.

137.title: PMC, police assure support for grand Ambedkar Jayanti celebrations
137.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) and police have assured support for grand celebrations to commemorate Ambedkar Jayanti on April 14. "I can assure cleanliness, provision of drinking water, washrooms and pandal at the statue of Babasaheb Ambedkar near the collector's office," PMC Commissioner Vikram Kumar said. Drone cameras may be deployed at locations for safety purposes, he added.

138.title: Salman felt that Sajid didn't have enough faith in his stardom: Report
138.article_body: Salman Khan's production house 'Salman Khan Films' will reportedly produce his upcoming film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', with producer Sajid Nadiadwala backing out of the film. "Salman felt that Sajid had developed cold feet and was not putting enough faith in the project and his stardom, whereas Sajid felt that Salman was taking things too lightly," the report added.

139.title: Films where dance is a natural element usually turn out very bad: Shahid
139.article_body: Shahid Kapoor said there have been many times in the past where songs have been added in his films just because he dances well, even if the song doesn't suit the movie. "Genuinely, I have been searching for a film where I can dance, and where dancing feels like a natural element...But the films...[of] that genre...[are] usually...so bad," added Shahid.

140.title: UK to launch its own NFT this summer, may use it to issue debt
140.article_body: UK's Chancellor of the Exchequer Rishi Sunak has directed the Royal Mint to introduce the country's own NFT by the summer, Economic Secretary to the Treasury John Glen said. He added that the NFT would be a symbol of the "forward-looking approach [the UK is] determined to take". The government may even consider issuing debt using the NFT, Glen said.

141.title: Sri Lanka's condition worrisome, India's could be worse: Sanjay Raut
141.article_body: Reacting to Sri Lanka's economic crisis, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that the country's situation is "worrisome". He further added that "India is on that path" and warned that if situation is not handled then India's condition will be worse than Sri Lanka. "Mamata Banerjee has also said to call for an all-party meeting under PM Modi's leadership," Raut added.

142.title: GB Nagar Police starts 'anti-Romeo' drive to ensure safety of women
142.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar Police has launched an 'anti-Romeo' drive in the district to ensure the safety of women, officials said. Women police personnel will carry out patrolling at crowded places, including metro stations, schools and colleges, ACP Ankita Sharma said. Police has also issued a helpline number where locals can raise a request for such a drive in their neighbourhood.

143.title: Twitter account of ex-IPS officer's wife hacked, complaint filed in Mumbai
143.article_body: Lawyer Abha Singh, wife of former IPS officer YP Singh, filed a complaint with Worli Police, alleging that her Twitter account was hacked on Sunday and the hacker demanded $500 to give her complete access to it. The accused reportedly put a Muslim man's picture as the profile picture. "I...changed the passwords of my other social media accounts," Singh said.

144.title: We must have a common culture post-merger: HDFC Chairman
144.article_body: HDFC and HDFC Bank "will have to have a common culture" after the merger, HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh said on Tuesday. "Now, bank will have to deal in housing loans which is very emotional, personal...So we have to be very careful with all our customers," he added. As per the announcement, HDFC will acquire a 41% stake in HDFC Bank.

145.title: Bangladesh to lodge official complaint about sledging, umpiring after Test defeat to SA
145.article_body: The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) will file a complaint with the ICC about sledging and umpiring during the Durban Test, which Bangladesh lost by 220 runs against South Africa. As per Bangladeshi players, umpires ignored their on-field complaints. The board said that the umpires also extended the lunch session to make up for half an hour instead of starting early.

146.title: Zomato shares decline after CCI orders probe
146.article_body: Shares of Zomato fell up to 5% on Tuesday after the Competition Commission of India (CCI) ordered an investigation into the conduct of Zomato and Swiggy. Zomato said it will assist the CCI in their investigation into the preferential listing of restaurant partners and pricing parity across platforms. Zomato shares later pared losses and were trading 2.61% lower on NSE.

147.title: Zebra foal born in Bengaluru Bannerghatta Biological Park
147.article_body: A zebra foal was born in Bengaluru Bannerghatta Biological Park on Monday. With this, the total count of zebras in the park has increased to five. "All necessary arrangements, including a partition within the enclosure to provide privacy and safety, have been made," said Deputy Director of the biological park. According to an official, the foal is suckling and active.

148.title: Mt Everest like you've never seen it before: NASA on pic of Earth's highest mountain
148.article_body: NASA shared a picture of Mt Everest and wrote, "Mt Everest like you've never seen it before." "The highest mountain on Earth takes on a different perspective from...vantage point of space. An astronaut aboard the International Space Station...took this near-nadir (almost straight down) photograph of Mount Everest, which towers approximately 29,029 feet (8,848 metres) above sea-level," wrote NASA.

149.title: Boss in UK pays 60 employees over ₹74,000 each to help them pay bills
149.article_body: A boss in the UK paid 60 of his workers £750 (over ₹74,000) each to help them pay their bills amid rising living costs in the country. The 51-year-old MD of Emerys Timber and Builders Merchants said he wanted to "share back the success of the business". UK energy regulator Ofgem has announced a hike in the energy price cap.

150.title: Man flies down to B'luru from Gujarat to snatch chains, arrested
150.article_body: A 26-year-old man, who allegedly came to Bengaluru by flight to commit chain-snatching to keep his wife happy, was detained by CK Achukattu Police. The accused, identified as Umesh Khatik, was arrested after police gathered information on a snatching case in which the bike-borne miscreant had snatched two gold chains from a woman on December 26 last year.

151.title: Ukraine Mayor, her family members found dead with hands tied: Police
151.article_body: Ukrainian authorities have found the bodies of the mayor of Motyzhyn village, her husband, and their son. Police said the dead had their hands tied behind their backs. The bodies were reportedly found half-buried in a grave in a pine forest near her house. Olga Sukhenko and her family were allegedly abducted by invading Russian forces on March 24.

152.title: Bill Gates shares old video of himself jumping over chair as Microsoft turns 47
152.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder and the world's fourth-richest person, Bill Gates, took to Instagram to share an old video of himself jumping over a chair to celebrate 47 years of Microsoft's existence. "It took leaps and bounds to accomplish Microsoft's vision of a computer on every desk and in every home," wrote Gates. Microsoft was founded on April 4, 1975.

153.title: Sounds reasonable: Elon Musk on 'two conditions' for edit button on Twitter
153.article_body: The world's richest person and Twitter's biggest shareholder, Elon Musk, responded "that sounds reasonable" to a tweet suggesting "two conditions" under which an edit button should be introduced on Twitter. The tweet suggested that the edit button should be available only for a few minutes and that the edit history should be visible. Musk owns a 9.2% stake in Twitter.

154.title: Pic shows dog refusing to abandon Ukrainian owner killed by Russian troops
154.article_body: A picture has been widely shared online showing a dog refusing to abandon its Ukrainian owner killed by Russian troops. Reacting to the picture of the dog sitting next to the body of its owner, a Twitter user wrote, "Such a heart-rending picture, I hope someone can take this poor dog in and feed and love him."

155.title: SpaceX, NASA delay launch of 1st private astronaut mission to ISS
155.article_body: SpaceX, NASA have delayed the launch of the 1st all-private mission to the International Space Station, Axiom Space's Ax-1 astronaut mission, to April 8. The mission will fly four civilians, including former NASA astronaut Michael López-Alegría, for a 10-day mission to the space station. The crew will ride atop a Falcon 9 rocket by Elon Musk's SpaceX.

156.title: Saffron-coloured caps, energy bars with PM's pic distributed to 400 BJP MPs
156.article_body: During the parliamentary meeting of the Bharatiya Janata Party, 400 BJP MPs were given saffron coloured caps and energy bars with Prime Minister Narendra Modi's picture on the wrapper. The caps were reportedly prepared in Surat after the party leadership approved the final design. The caps have the name and symbol of the party on them.

157.title: Ukrainian woman writes family details on daughter's back in case she's killed; pic surfaces
157.article_body: Ukrainian mothers are writing family details on their children's bodies in case their parents are killed by Russians. Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's former spokesperson tweeted a photo, saying, "A Ukrainian mom wrote on her daughter's body the name, date of birth, numbers of parents so if she is lost or they are killed during war someone can help the girl."

158.title: It's not only for azaan: K'taka CM on demand for loudspeaker ban in mosques
158.article_body: Commenting on the demand by some organisations to ban loudspeakers in mosques, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "It is not only for azaan, it is for all loudspeakers." He added that it is a high court order and it is not forced. "Everything has to be done by talking and explaining to people...So, we will take a call," Bommai stated.

159.title: DJ Khaled to be honoured with a star on Hollywood Walk of Fame
159.article_body: DJ Khaled will be honoured with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. The 46-year-old American DJ will be the 2,719th celebrity to receive a star on the walkway. "DJ Khaled is one of the most popular and ever-present impresarios of the rap industry and we're thrilled to honour him!" said Ana Martinez, Hollywood Walk of Fame Producer.

160.title: My parents were separated; didn't tell anyone I'm Pankaj Kapur's son: Shahid
160.article_body: Shahid Kapoor revealed that he initially feared that he wouldn't make it as an actor. "My parents were separated, and I didn't use to live in Bombay, I came here...late," he said. "My mother was a single mom, and I was a little older while Ishaan (Khatter) was very young. I never told anyone...[about being Pankaj Kapur's son]," he added.

161.title: MNS Muslim leader resigns, accuses party of turning 'communal'
161.article_body: A Muslim politician, Majid Shaikh, has tendered his resignation from the Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) by accusing it of being "more focused on communalism". "Raj saheb was an icon for me...that's why I had joined...in 2009. But now...politics of communalism has crept in MNS," Shaikh said. Notably, the Pune-based politician was an MNS branch head.

162.title: Haryana CM moves resolution on Chandigarh issue, Sutlej-Yamuna canal
162.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday moved a resolution in the state Assembly noting with concern the Punjab Assembly's recent move on the transfer of the joint capital of Chandigarh. Khattar's resolution also urged the central government to take steps to construct the Sutlej Yamuna Link (SYL) Canal. He accused Punjab of enacting legislations to deny Haryana's rightful claims.

163.title: Tharoor shares 2018 tweet on edit button, says 'Even our bureaucracy is quicker'
163.article_body: Amid speculations of an edit button on Twitter, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor remarked, "Even responses from our bureaucracy tend to be quicker." Sharing his 2018 tweet, where he called for an edit button, Tharoor wrote, "If it's real, thanks for listening in 2018 and acting in 2022!" Twitter on April 1 had said it was working on an edit button.

164.title: Russian troops need significant re-equipping & refurbishment: UK
164.article_body: The British Defence Ministry said that Ukrainian forces have retaken key terrain in the north after forcing Russia to retreat from the areas around Chernihiv and north of the capital, Kyiv. "Many Russian units withdrawing from northern Ukraine are likely to require significant re-equipping and refurbishment before being available to redeploy for operations in eastern Ukraine," it added.

165.title: Our belief within ourselves is what I believe is going to help us win: Plessis
165.article_body: Ahead of their match against RR on Tuesday night, RCB captain Faf du Plessis addressed the team and said that their belief in themselves is the most important thing that'll help them win this tournament. "Everyone should play their part to get us across the line...we don't rely on one big superstar to win us the trophy," he added.

166.title: 3 rob driver of his taxi in Punjab, give him ₹150 bus fare to reach home
166.article_body: Three miscreants, posing as passengers, robbed a driver of his taxi in Punjab's Khanna. The accused had booked a taxi to Khanna, who upon reaching the destination, took out their gun and asked the driver to get off. They also gave him ₹150 bus fare to reach Moga, where he belonged while fleeing, the cab driver told police.

167.title: Maximum temperature in Delhi to touch 39 degrees Celsius today: IMD
167.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday said that the maximum temperature in Delhi is expected to touch 39 degrees Celsius, while the air quality index (AQI) may stay in 'poor' category. The minimum temperature is likely to stay at 19 degrees Celsius, as per IMD's forecast. On Monday, the maximum temperature was recorded at 38.1 degrees Celsius in Delhi.

168.title: Stepped as a student, not co-star: Charan on working with dad Chiranjeevi
168.article_body: Speaking about his experience of working with his father, actor Chiranjeevi in 'Acharya', actor Ram Charan said, "It's a dream come true...I don't think I stepped into 'Acharya' as a co-star, I've stepped...as...student and I've learned a lot from him." "He never handheld me through any of the shooting days...He let me make mistakes...But...never lost his cool," Charan added.

169.title: Facial recognition system to be launched at Pune airport in 2023
169.article_body: A facial recognition system will be launched at Pune's Lohegaon Airport by March 2023, Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh said in Parliament. The system will be launched as part of the Centre's Digi Yatra initiative to provide passengers "seamless and hassle-free experience at airports". The system's preliminary testing has been completed, he added.

170.title: NCPCR objects to textbook chapter by Harsh Mander, writes to NCERT
170.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has objected to the inclusion of a chapter titled 'Weathering the Storm in Ersama' authored by social activist Harsh Mander in Class IX English textbook. In a letter seeking reply from NCERT, the rights body said the story suggests that rescue and welfare work are done only by NGOs.

171.title: Was told should do ₹150-cr film, people will put money after Kabir Singh: Shahid
171.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said that after the film 'Kabir Singh', everyone said that he should do a ₹150-crore film and that people will back him up with money. "I thought, sure they will put money, but what will the film be? There's a difference between making a scaled film and a good film," Shahid added.

172.title: I admire Aishwarya's dignity in tough times; lucky to have her: Abhishek
172.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan praised his wife, actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and said that he and his family are lucky to have her in their lives. "She's always been an amazing emotional support for me," he added. "[Aishwarya] has...managed to traverse some of the most difficult times of her life with utmost dignity and grace. I...admire that about her," Abhishek said.

173.title: Determined to do whatever needed to ensure Cong's unity: Sonia Gandhi
173.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi said the road ahead for the party is "more challenging than ever before", which will put to test the party’s dedication, determination and spirit of resilience. "Unity at all levels of our vast organisation is of paramount importance and speaking for myself, I am determined to do whatever is needed to ensure it," Sonia Gandhi added.

174.title: Amy recalls joke on Alec's shooting incident that wasn't allowed at Oscars
174.article_body: American stand-up comedian Amy Schumer said that she wasn't allowed to make a joke about last year's shooting incident involving actor Alec Baldwin.
