349.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Monday called Vladimir Putin a war criminal and said that he would call for a war crimes trial against the Russian President. Biden's comments come amid a global outcry over atrocities against civilians in Ukraine. The bodies of 410 civilians were removed from towns that were recently retaken from Russian forces, a Ukrainian official said.

350.title: Sri Lanka's economic condition is bad, but India's is worse: Mamata
350.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday said that India's financial condition is worse than Sri Lanka's and urged the Centre to call for an all-party meeting to address it. "Fuel prices have been hiked 11 times in 13 days. The interest on Provident Fund has been slashed. From railways to banks, everything is being sold off," Mamata said.

351.title: Didn't know role of producer when I joined film industry: Vidya
351.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan has revealed that she was not aware of the producer's role in a film when she had started working in the industry. However, Vidya added she realised the producer's role after working in female-led films like 'Ishqiya' and 'No One Killed Jessica'. "The role of a producer and director is equally important for a film," she stated.

352.title: Aamir begins pre-production work of his next film with Ranbir: Report
352.article_body: Aamir Khan has reportedly started working on the pre-production of his upcoming film with Ranbir Kapoor. "This yet-to-be-titled project will be made on a massive scale...will have an important message for...audience," a source was quoted by Pinkvilla. Film's shooting will reportedly begin after the release of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Aamir...Ranbir are very excited about the film," the source added.

353.title: I hate 'billionaire' stories, my son's friends look at us differently: Zerodha CEO
353.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath told Moneycontrol he hates 'billionaire' and 'unicorn' stories. "It creates a wrong image and affects everyone around us like my son's friends, his teachers, our neighbours...they look at us in a different way," Kamath said. "I used to play basketball with the kids and now they...treat me like a billionaire who can't be hurt," he added.

354.title: Krishna has all qualities to be India's successful all-format pacer: Buttler
354.article_body: Praising Prasidh Krishna, England wicketkeeper-batter Jos Buttler said the 26-year-old has got all the qualities to become a "very successful" fast bowler for India in all formats of the game. "He has some pace in...nets and skills...I see him playing red-ball cricket for India as well," he added. Krishna made his international debut in ODI format in March 2021.

355.title: Will ensure police remain ahead of criminals: Shah on Criminal Procedure Bill
355.article_body: Lok Sabha passed the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill by voice vote on Monday. Union Home Minister Amit Shah said the Bill has been brought in to ensure that police and investigators remain two steps ahead of criminals. The Bill seeks to provide legal sanction to police to take physical and biological samples of convicts and persons accused of crimes.

356.title: Nortje returns to training ahead of DC vs LSG, DC shares pic
356.article_body: Ahead of DC-LSG in IPL 2022, DC have posted a picture of pacer Anrich Nortje on Twitter practising in nets on Monday and wrote, "Nortje. Training. That's it. That's the post." Nortje hasn't played since T20I World Cup 2021 due to hip and back injuries. He has to get clearance from Cricket South Africa before making it to playing XI.

357.title: 2 labourers shot by militants in Pulwama, 2nd attack within 24 hrs
357.article_body: A day after two migrant workers were shot at and injured in south Kashmir, suspected militants fired at two more non-local labourers in Pulwama, reports said. The injured labourers have been shifted to the district hospital in Pulwama for treatment and are in stable condition, reports added. Both labourers are from Bihar, reports said.

358.title: Sri Lankan Opp'n rejects Prez's invite to join Cabinet amid crisis
358.article_body: Sri Lanka's largest opposition party, Samagi Jana Balawegaya, rejected an invitation from President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to form a unity government amid the economic crisis. Rajapaksa had invited "all political parties...to come together to accept ministerial portfolios in order to find solutions to this national crisis". All 26 Cabinet Ministers had resigned amid protests against the government.

359.title: Chintu, you've hit last ball out of stadium: Javed on 'Sharmaji...'
359.article_body: Lyricist Javed Akhtar took to Twitter on Monday and praised Rishi Kapoor and Paresh Rawal-starrer 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. "Watched 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. So well written and directed. Thank you Paresh saheb for your most unusual and great contribution," Javed tweeted. He further said, "Now my friend Chintu (Rishi), ultimately it's your show. You have hit the last ball out of the stadium."

360.title: Market for nuclear missiles, bombs to surge 73% by 2030: Report
360.article_body: The global market for nuclear missiles and bombs is estimated to surpass $126 billion by 2030, an Allied Market Research report said. This is a nearly 73% rise from the 2020 levels. The report has predicted that the fastest growth in this segment would come from Asia-Pacific region on initiatives by India, Pakistan and China to bolster their nuclear arsenals.

361.title: Our musicians wear body armour instead of tuxedos: Zelenskyy in Grammys address
361.article_body: While appearing in a pre-recorded video at Sunday night's Grammy Awards, Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Our musicians wear body armour instead of tuxedos." "They sing to the wounded in hospitals. Even to those who can't hear them. But the music will break through anyway," he added. Zelenskyy urged, "Support us in any way you can...but not silence."

362.title: My high-pitched voice is 'manufacturing defect', I don't get angry: Amit Shah
362.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while speaking in the Lok Sabha on Monday, said, "My high-pitched voice is a manufacturing defect. I don't get angry." He added that he only gets angry on questions related to Kashmir. Shah moved the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill, 2022 for consideration and passage in the House.

363.title: Quite emotional: Keshav Maharaj on his 7/32 in 1st Test vs Bangladesh
363.article_body: South Africa spinner Keshav Maharaj said he was "quite emotional" after his 7/32 in fourth innings of first Test led his side to a 220-run win against Bangladesh in Durban. Chasing a 274-run target, Bangladesh were bowled out for 53 runs in fourth innings. "Playing at home is always special. Glad...I could take the team over the line," he added.

364.title: It's special to score my ton vs Netherlands with Taylor on other end: Young
364.article_body: New Zealand batter Will Young said it was a "special moment" to have Ross Taylor on the other end when he scored his century (120) in third and final ODI against the Netherlands. The match was Taylor's 450th and last for New Zealand. "I tried to take the pressure off him and allowed him to enjoy the occasion," he added.

365.title: 3 shot dead by armed men over land dispute in Punjab's Gurdaspur
365.article_body: A group of armed men shot dead three persons in Punjab's Gurdaspur district on Monday over an alleged land dispute. The husband of a woman sarpanch, along with two others, was standing in his field, when the group reportedly arrived from Dasuya to take possession of the land. The group opened fire at the victims when they resisted the takeover.

366.title: Paytm Payments Bank yet to appoint firm for IT audit: Govt
366.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad said Paytm Payments Bank hasn't yet appointed a firm to conduct an audit of its IT systems. On March 11, RBI barred the bank from onboarding new customers and ordered it to appoint an audit firm. Order followed a report that the bank allegedly leaked data to Chinese entities, Bloomberg reported citing sources.

367.title: FIIs & FPIs may come and go, retail investors take care of markets: FM
367.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said that retail investors have brought a shock-absorbing capacity into the Indian markets. "FIIs and FPIs may come and go but today the Indian retail investors have proven that any shock that may come in is now taken care of," she added. Sitharaman further informed Lok Sabha that the inflow of FDI remains unabated.

368.title: PM Modi congratulates Indian composer Ricky Kej for 2nd Grammy win
368.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday congratulated Indian music composer Ricky Kej for winning the second Grammy Award. Ricky won the award for 'Divine Tides' in Best New Age Album category. 'Congratulations for this remarkable feat and best wishes for your future endeavours!" PM Modi said in his congratulatory message to Ricky.

369.title: Virat is passionate about his cricket, wants to win every game: Kaul
369.article_body: RCB pacer Siddharth Kaul, in a conversation with Under-19 player Aneeshwar Gautam, said Virat Kohli will give Aneeshwar the "best guidance". "People around the world know about Virat's work ethic and fitness and how he's passionate about his cricket and how he just wants to win every game," Kaul added. Kaul and Virat have played together in the Under-19 team.

370.title: Halsey says 'Had to watch BTS', leaves Grammys early after surgery
370.article_body: Singer Halsey took to Instagram Stories on Sunday to announce that she left the 2022 Grammys early as she was not feeling well but had to see BTS perform before leaving. The South Korean boy band performed their English single 'Butter' at the ceremony. Halsey had earlier announced that she underwent surgery three days ahead of the Grammys.

371.title: My Instagram account hacked or suspended: Aishwarya Rajesh
371.article_body: Tamil actress Aishwarya Rajesh took to Twitter on Monday to announce that her Instagram account has either been hacked or suspended. The actress also tagged Instagram's official handle and asked them to help resolve the issue as soon as possible. This comes a day after actress Yami Gautam announced that her Instagram account may have been hacked.

372.title: Chandigarh belongs to Punjab, next battle for river waters: Sidhu
372.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Monday said Chandigarh belongs to Punjab and will always remain so and added that its next big battle with Haryana will be over river waters. Built on 27 villages of Punjab, Chandigarh was, is and will remain a part of Punjab, Sidhu tweeted in Hindi.

373.title: Ishaan Khatter buys Triumph Bonneville Speed Twin bike worth ₹13 lakh
373.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter on Sunday took to Instagram to share a series of pictures of his new bike Triumph Bonneville Speed Twin which is worth ₹13 lakh. He wrote, "Au naturel with my new love, Speedy Gonzales." His brother Shahid Kapoor commented, "Look at this new biker boy in town," while his mother wrote, "Speedy Gonzales keep my boy safe."

374.title: Crypto payments worth ₹2.2 cr made in 11 drug trafficking cases: Govt
374.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau and Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs have unearthed crypto payments worth ₹2.2 crore in 11 drug trafficking cases, Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said. Government is taking steps to check such usage, he added. Liaisoning with technical experts and coordination with foreign drug law enforcement agencies is being done regularly, Chaudhary said.

375.title: 'RRR' crosses ₹900 crore-mark globally, only 5th Indian film to do so: Reports
375.article_body: 'RRR' crossed the ₹900-crore mark globally on Sunday, trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan tweeted. The film earned ₹82.40 crore on Sunday, taking its second weekend total to ₹192 crore and overall earnings to ₹901.46 crore. 'RRR' is reportedly the only fifth Indian film to cross the ₹900-crore mark after 'Dangal', 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion', 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' and 'Secret Superstar'.

376.title: No sense for SRH to open the batting with Abhishek Sharma: Chopra
376.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that there is "no sense" for the Sunrisers Hyderabad to use their 21-year-old player Abhishek Sharma as an opening batter. "Don’t open with him [Sharma]. Instead, open with Rahul Tripathi and Washington Sundar...He [Sundar] is being wasted lower down the order...I would bat Abhishek Sharma at 6," Chopra said.

377.title: Russia imposes visa restrictions on citizens of 'unfriendly countries'
377.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a decree for visa restrictions for citizens of countries that Russia deems "unfriendly" after sanctions over Ukraine. Russia suspended simplified visa issuance regime with some EU countries as well as Norway, Switzerland, Denmark and Iceland. In March, Russia approved a list of "unfriendly countries" including the US, Canada, Britain, EU states and Ukraine.

378.title: Pic of Rajasthan constable running to save child amid Karauli violence surfaces
378.article_body: A photo of a Rajasthan Police constable running past burning buildings while rescuing an infant amid violence in Karauli is being shared on social media. According to Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, 31-year-old Netresh Sharma saved the lives of at least four people while performing his duty. Gehlot spoke to the constable and promoted him to the post of Head Constable.

379.title: Guj BJP youth unit to hold 3,000-km march to mark 75 yrs of Independence
379.article_body: The Gujarat BJP's youth unit will hold a statewide march, Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav Yatra, to mark 75 years of Independence. The march will begin on April 6 in Ahmedabad and will conclude on April 25 in Surat. According to Prashant Korat, state president of the Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha, the 3,000-km long march will have tableaus on Independence-related themes.

380.title: Didn't cry when parents died, cried at Anupam's death in Kashmir Files: Vivek
380.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri shared a behind-the-scenes video from the film's scene depicting Anupam Kher's character Pushkar Nath's death. He wrote, "When my mother died in 2004...When my father died in 2008, I didn't cry. But when I shot this death scene with Anupam Kher I couldn't stop...Such is the intensity of pain of our Kashmiri Hindu parents."

381.title: Sunday meets with fans at Jalsa to be revived perhaps: Amitabh Bachchan
381.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, who called off his weekly meet-and-greet with his fans at Jalsa in March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic, has hinted at reviving the meets. Taking to his blog, Amitabh wrote, "News about...Mumbai is that no more masks and protocol of COVID...which comes as a blessing...perhaps the Sunday meets at the Jalsa gate...to be revived."

382.title: It was pretty special: Elgar on SA's 1st Test win against Bangladesh
382.article_body: Describing South Africa's 220-run victory against Bangladesh in the first Test as "pretty special", South Africa captain Dean Elgar said it was a hard-fought win in Durban. "It's not often we've had a Test go into five days...been a hard graft playing in conditions that we're not used to seeing," he added. South Africa are 1-0 ahead in two-match series.

383.title: 2 hikers dead, 2 injured in landslide in Australia's Blue Mountains
383.article_body: Two hikers, including a 9-year-old boy, were killed and two others were critically injured on Monday in a landslide in the Blue Mountains in Australia's New South Wales state. The injured hikers have suffered head and abdominal injuries, paramedics said. The victims are British nationals who were holidaying in Australia, according to a police statement.

384.title: 18-yr-old Alcaraz beats Ruud to become youngest Miami Open men's champion
384.article_body: Fourteenth seed Carlos Alcaraz defeated sixth seed Casper Ruud 7-5, 6-4 in Miami Open final to win his first ATP Masters 1000 title on Sunday. Notably, 18-year-old Alcaraz is the youngest Miami men's champion in the event's 37-year-old history and first Spanish man to win in Miami after eight previous final appearances by his compatriots, including five by Rafael Nadal.

385.title: SRH to bowl first against LSG in their IPL 2022 clash, playing XIs out
385.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against LSG in their IPL 2022 clash. SRH are fielding the same playing XI that featured in their IPL 2022 opener against RR. LSG have made one change to their playing XI, with bowling all-rounder Jason Holder replacing Dushmantha Chameera.

386.title: Woman cheats Pune techie of ₹9 lakh through matrimonial site, arrested
386.article_body: A woman, sought by Pune's Koregaon Park Police on charges of cheating a 36-year-old IT company worker of ₹9.25 lakh last year, has been caught in Goa. According to police, the accused, Reema Sandhu, contacted the victim using a fake profile on a matrimonial website and later asked him to transfer money on pretext of requiring help for legal case.

387.title: Online exams to fill 128 medical posts from 19,015 applications: PCMC
387.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation has received 19,015 applications for 128 medical posts, that will be filled through online examinations. All the posts are permanent, but no interviews will be conducted, officials said. Assistant Municipal Commissioner Balasaheb Khandekar said that arrangements are underway to make examination rooms available in different districts.

388.title: Only 10% kids in 12-14 age group COVID-19 vaccinated in Mumbai: BMC
388.article_body: Around 38,365 of the 4 lakh children between 12 and 14 years of age have been vaccinated against COVID-19 in Mumbai, which is only 10% of the targeted population, according to BMC data. Health department officials said the response to the drive, which began on March 16, has been lower than expected due to the dip in the daily cases.

389.title: Free solar mobile charging unit installed in Navi Mumbai's Kharghar
389.article_body: A free solar-powered mobile charging unit has been installed in Navi Mumbai's Kharghar, which is a first in the area. MLC Balaram Patil, who inaugurated the unit at a sector 15 bus stand on the occasion of Gudi Padwa said, "This is a state-of-the-art concept that'll benefit...common man." Earlier, a similar unit was set up in the New Panvel area.

390.title: Ross Taylor breaks down during national anthem in his last int'l match, video viral
390.article_body: Ross Taylor, who played his last international cricket match today, broke down when New Zealand's national anthem was being played ahead of the third ODI against Netherlands. Taylor's children also accompanied him during the national anthem. Taylor played 112 Tests, 236 ODIs and 102 T20Is in his career, scoring 18,195 runs.

391.title: Economic crisis makes Sri Lankan stocks world's worst performers after Russia
391.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's worst economic crisis, the country's stocks have fallen about 33% in 2022, making them the world's worst performers after Russian equities. In 2021, the Sri Lanka Colombo Stock Exchange had rallied 80%, posting the world's best performance after Mongolia. On Monday, the central bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal resigned amid soaring inflation and fuel shortage.

392.title: 2nd Grammy win is beautiful recognition of my life choices: Ricky Kej
392.article_body: Indian composer Ricky Kej said that winning a second Grammy award is a "beautiful recognition" of his life choices. Ricky won the award for 'Divine Tides' in Best New Age Album category. "I feel strongly about making this world...better place, that's the only kind of music that I make," he stated. Ricky won his first Grammy award in 2015.

393.title: Heartbreaking to see what Sri Lanka is going through: Jacqueline
393.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's economic crisis and emergency, actress Jacqueline Fernandez took to Instagram to support her native country. "As a Sri Lankan, it's heartbreaking to see what my country and countrymen are going through," she wrote. "I'm hoping this situation comes to an end soon and through means which are peaceful and for the benefit of the people," she added.

394.title: Delhi govt will draw summer action plan to fight pollution: Minister
394.article_body: The Delhi government will prepare a 14-point summer action plan to fight pollution in the capital, Environment Minister Gopal Rai said on Monday. He said the plan will focus on open burning of garbage, fires at landfill sites, increasing green cover on the roadside, rejuvenation of water bodies, parks, tree transplantation monitoring, development of an eco-waste park and more.

395.title: Meat shops should be shut during Navratri: South Delhi Mayor to officers
395.article_body: The South Delhi Municipal Corporation on Monday issued an order asking officers concerned to take action for the closure of meat shops during Navratri till April 11. The order issued by Mayor Mukkesh Suryaan said, "In these days...sight of meat being sold in open and near temples makes [people] uncomfortable." It added, "Their religious belief and sentiments are also affected."

396.title: Ram Charan gifts gold coins to 35 'RRR' technicians; pics surface
396.article_body: Actor Ram Charan gifted gold coins to nearly 35 unit members of his film 'RRR' after inviting them over for a meal at his residence in Hyderabad. He presented them with sweets and a gold coin, each weighing 11.6 grams, reports said. The technicians included various heads of filmmaking departments like direction and camera, production managers, still photographers, and accountants.

397.title: Ananya Panday and Ishaan Khatter break up after 3 years: Reports
397.article_body: Actors Ananya Panday and Ishaan Khatter have broken up after dating for three years, media reports, including those from Pinkvilla and TOI, said on Monday. "They bonded well on the sets of 'Khaali Peeli' and that led to the beginning of a new journey," Pinkvilla reported. "It has been a mutual call...and things ended on a positive note," it added.

398.title: KGF 2 to be 1st South film to release in Greece, breaks UK pre-sale record
398.article_body: Yash-starrer 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' will become the first South Indian film to be released in Greece on April 14. The advance booking for the film began in the UK and sold 5,000 tickets within 12 hours which is the highest ever for any Indian film. 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' will also be released in the US and South America.

399.title: Varun shares old video with Triple H as he retires from WrestleMania
399.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan on Monday took to Instagram to share an old video of him interacting with wrestler Triple H after the latter announced his retirement from WrestleMania. He wrote, "One of my all-time favourite WWE superstars hung up his boots at WrestleMania. I was fortunate enough to...talk to him about my love of pro wrestling and the rock."

400.title: I shut out everyone, was only talking to Rohit and Mahi bhai: Pant on getting dropped
400.article_body: Talking about the time when he was dropped from India's limited-overs squad in 2019, Rishabh Pant said, "It was a hard time...I shut out everyone." "It was difficult for me to go to many people. I wanted to prove myself to the world. I was only talking to Rohit Sharma and Mahi bhai (MS Dhoni) a  little bit," he said.

401.title: CCI orders probe into Zomato and Swiggy
401.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Monday ordered an investigation into the conduct of online food delivery platforms Zomato and Swiggy. "There exists a prima facie case with respect to some of the conduct of Zomato and Swiggy," the CCI said. The antitrust body will probe allegations including delayed payment cycle, imposition of one-sided clauses and exorbitant commission.
